summary: Crossref assigns separate DOIs to peer review materials with version/type suffixes - response vs review for same paper should not be marked as duplicates

response.title: Author response for manuscript d4nj04926h version 2

review.title: Reviewer 2 comments for manuscript d4nj04926h version 2

notes: DOI suffix pattern: /v[0-9]+/(response|review|decision)[0-9]*. These are peer review artifacts from journals that implement open peer review. Titles share most content (manuscript ID, version). These are fundamentally different documents. Policy question: should we even import these DOIs? They're not relevant for evidence synthesis. If we do import them, they must be treated as NOT_DUPLICATE even with title similarity.
